programme.title: 2024 US Open Tennis
programme.desc: From the USTA Billie Jean King National Tennis Center in Flushing, N.Y.

programme.title: SportsCenter With Scott Van Pelt
programme.desc: SVP's up at midnight and bringing his unique perspective on games people play to "SportsCenter" viewers. The hourlong, late-night show is driven by the host's self-deprecating wit and passion for sports, with featured elements, including Van Pelt's nightly "1 Big Thing" commentary and a weekly look back at the moments that drove bettors wild in "Bad Beats." The show also delivers what "SportsCenter" fans are used to -- news and highlights, guests and interviews -- but in a different, fast-paced and insightful way.

programme.title: SportsCenter With Scott Van Pelt
programme.desc: SVP's up at midnight and bringing his unique perspective on games people play to "SportsCenter" viewers. The hourlong, late-night show is driven by the host's self-deprecating wit and passion for sports, with featured elements, including Van Pelt's nightly "1 Big Thing" commentary and a weekly look back at the moments that drove bettors wild in "Bad Beats." The show also delivers what "SportsCenter" fans are used to -- news and highlights, guests and interviews -- but in a different, fast-paced and insightful way.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: ESPN's morning show features host Mike Greenberg with a rotating and diverse group of analysts opining about and analyzing the latest news from the world of sports. The two-hour, personality-driven show originates from Manhattan's South Street Seaport, a locale that attracts high-profile guests. Greenberg, aka "Greeny," is formerly one-half of ESPN Radio's longtime "Mike & Mike" morning show.

programme.title: First Take
programme.desc: Stephen A. Smith joins host Molly Qerim on this weekday morning sports debate show. Smith provides his expert takes on the day's trending sports topics and under-the-radar news. They're regularly joined by veteran analysts and the top guests in sports and entertainment.

programme.title: The Pat McAfee Show
programme.desc: Former NFL punter Pat McAfee brings his humor and candor to the microphone to highlight the day's top stories.

programme.title: College GameDay
programme.desc: Originating from the site of Saturday's biggest games, host Rece Davis and analysts Lee Corso, Kirk Herbstreit, Desmond Howard, and Pat McAfee cover college football with pregame breakdowns, exclusive interviews, features and predictions.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The Green Wave run up against the No. 17 Wildcats in Week 2. Tulane blanked Southeastern Louisiana 52-0 in its opener, while Kansas State rolled past Tennessee-Martin 41-6. The Green Wave held off the Wildcats for a 17-10 victory in 2022.

programme.title: College Football Scoreboard
programme.desc: Presenting up-to-the-minute scores and highlights during the college football season.

programme.title: 2024 US Open Tennis
programme.desc: A. Sabalenka vs. J. Pegula.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: Kalen DeBoer and his No. 4 Crimson Tide host the Bulls. Kalen DeBoer became the first Alabama coach to win his first game via shutout since Wallace Wade in 1923 with a 63-0 Week 1 rout of Western Kentucky. Alabama defeated South Florida 17-3 in 2023.

programme.title: College Football Final
programme.desc: Once the day's slate of college football games is complete, ESPN recaps the action and discusses its implications on the top 25. Matt Barrie hosts with analysts Joey Galloway and Dan Mullen.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The Sun Devils host the Bulldogs in a meeting of Power Four conference foes. The Jeff Lebby era in Mississippi State began with a 56-7 rout of Eastern Kentucky. Arizona State nearly shut out Wyoming in its opener, but settled for a 48-7 outcome.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: College Football Final
programme.desc: Once the day's slate of college football games is complete, ESPN recaps the action and discusses its implications on the top 25. Matt Barrie hosts with analysts Joey Galloway and Dan Mullen.

programme.title: NFL Matchup
programme.desc: An NFL Films production, "NFL Matchup" is definitely a show for football junkies. Unlike traditional football preview programs, this one gives fans an in-depth look at some of Sunday's games by breaking down the strategy and tactics -- the Xs and Os -- through the exclusive use of team-supplied footage. That type of film study is a forte of former NFL player and executive Louis Riddick and NFL Films producer Greg Cosell, whose work is featured here alongside host Sal Paolantonio.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: Kalen DeBoer and his No. 4 Crimson Tide host the Bulls. Kalen DeBoer became the first Alabama coach to win his first game via shutout since Wallace Wade in 1923 with a 63-0 Week 1 rout of Western Kentucky. Alabama defeated South Florida 17-3 in 2023.

programme.title: Sunday NFL Countdown
programme.desc: This Sunday pregame staple debuted in 1985 and soon became a signature ESPN series. Host Samantha Ponder introduces the features and directs the storylines associated with the day's games, joined by a roster of analysts highlighted by ex-NFL players, coaches and executives including Tedy Bruschi, Randy Moss, Matt Hasselbeck, Rex Ryan and Louis Riddick. Chris Mortensen and Adam Schefter deliver breaking news and injury updates, while reporters at game sites set the scenes.

programme.title: NWSL Soccer
programme.desc: From Red Bull Arena in Harrison, N.J.

programme.title: Fútbol W
programme.desc: Ali Krieger and Sebastian Salazar host a weekly studio program featuring comprehensive coverage of professional women's soccer.

programme.title: WNBA Countdown
programme.desc: WNBA news, analysis, highlights and interviews.

programme.title: WNBA Basketball
programme.desc: From Barclays Center in Brooklyn, N.Y.

programme.title: Baseball Tonight: Sunday Night Countdown
programme.desc: Leading into each of ESPN's Sunday Night Baseball telecasts is this special edition of "Baseball Tonight." Host Karl Ravech teams with analysts and reporters to present fans a detailed preview of the network's exclusive, national game of the week. Highlights of the day's other games, interviews with players and managers, and key storylines from around the league also fill the hourlong show. Mark Teixeira, Eduardo Pérez, Tim Kurkjian and Buster Olney are among the analysts.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: From Minute Maid Park in Houston.

programme.title: Always College Football
programme.desc: Greg McElroy explores the sport with the biggest names on and off the field. With off-seasons being a thing of the past, McElroy goes year-round with analysis, opinions and insight on top teams and under-the-radar stories from coast to coast.

programme.title: NBA Today
programme.desc: In-depth, comprehensive daily coverage of all aspects of the NBA from expert analysts.

programme.title: UFC: The Walk
programme.desc: An in-depth look at Valentina Shevchenko and Jessica Eye and their journeys to the Octagon ahead of UFC 238.

programme.title: UFC Unleashed
programme.desc: Witness the rise of "Sugar" Sean O'Malley to superstardom with a collection of his biggest wins to date.

programme.title: UFC Main Events
programme.desc: Valentina Shevchenko takes on Holly Holm, from July 23, 2016.

programme.title: Where Wolf: The Search for ChiefsAholic
programme.desc: Unraveling the story of Xaviar Babudar, the Kansas City Chiefs superfan whose criminal double life landed him in federal prison.

programme.title: Around the Horn
programme.desc: Hosted by Tony Reali in the ESPN studio and joined via satellite by four panelists from across the country, the team debates popular sports stories. Reali acts as moderator, giving points for well-made arguments and deducting points for those who inspire him to hit the "mute" button. At the end of the show, whomever Reali deems the winner has 30 seconds without interruption to voice their final opinions on any topic they want.

programme.title: Pardon the Interruption
programme.desc: The debate is the story in this fast-paced, half-hour series hosted by former Washington Post sportswriters Tony Kornheiser and Michael Wilbon. The pair engage in high-energy discussions, conduct interviews and often argue over topics not even related to sports. Other sports reporters appear as guests and offer opinions on the top stories of the day.

programme.title: College Football Live
programme.desc: Want to know up-to-the-minute reports about your favorite college football team? ESPN has it covered with this weekday studio show, a roundtable format that emphasizes discussion and opinions on the sport's biggest stories and newsmakers. The half-hour program features a rotating roster of analysts that includes coaches, former players, and media personalities.

programme.title: The Path: LSU Football
programme.desc: An in-depth, behind-the-scenes look at the LSU football team's season.

programme.title: The Pulse: Texas A&M Football
programme.desc: "The Pulse: Texas A&M Football" is an all-access pass to Jimbo Fisher and the Aggies team, all from the comfort of your living room. The 12th Man Productions team takes you behind the scenes of Aggie football -- from the hard work put in on the practice fields and in-game emotions to locker room speeches and off-the-field fun. "The Pulse" walks you through the week-by-week lives of the Aggie football players. The 30-minute show premieres every game week throughout the season. Fisher and his staff embrace the grind as they prepare for another season in the SEC.

programme.title: UFC: The Walk
programme.desc: An in-depth look at Valentina Shevchenko and Jessica Eye and their journeys to the Octagon ahead of UFC 238.

programme.title: UFC Unleashed
programme.desc: A collection of women athletes and champions who have become the biggest stars in the UFC.

programme.title: E60
programme.desc: ESPN's morning sports magazine show, featuring the biggest names and stories in sports.

programme.title: Unsportsmanlike with Evan, Canty and Michelle
programme.desc: Start the day off right with Chris Canty, Evan Cohen and Michelle Smallmon providing an energizing and informative way to take on the day. Sports, life and laughter are what it's all about.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. Sports Reporters
programme.desc: A guest panel discusses sports headlines. The panel is typically made up of sports columnists and journalists such as Mike Lupica, Bob Ryan and Mitch Albom. The group weighs in with their personal opinions and predictions for upcoming events.

programme.title: NBA Today
programme.desc: In-depth, comprehensive daily coverage of all aspects of the NBA from expert analysts.

programme.title: NFL Live
programme.desc: Host Laura Rutledge takes the helm of this weekday show featuring the likes of Marcus Spears, Dan Orlovsky, Mina Kimes, and Adam Schefter. The "NFL Live" crew entertains fans while offering all the latest news and analysis from across the NFL.

programme.title: ESPN BET Live
programme.desc: ESPN Sports Betting Analysts Erin Dolan and Joe Fortenbaugh, along with host Tyler Fulghum, break down the biggest storylines through the lens of sports betting, with breakdowns, discussions and picks.

programme.title: College Football Countdown
programme.desc: A look at the day's college football action, featuring news, highlights and game previews.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: SMU continues its first campaign as an ACC member by taking on BYU of the Big 12. BYU stopped a late two-point try to beat SMU 24-23 in the 2022 New Mexico Bowl. That marked the last meeting between the former Western Athletic Conference rivals.

programme.desc: From UFC Apex in Las Vegas.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Chronicling the story of the Heisman Trophy race of 1997, with future Hall of Famers Peyton Manning and Charles Woodson headlining a cast of players and living at the center of a debate.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: The fascinating back story behind the famous/infamous 1988 "Catholics vs. Convicts" college football game between Notre Dame and the University of Miami. The slogan summarized the subtext of cultural and racial tensions brewing between the schools.

programme.title: UFC Live
programme.desc: From UFC Apex in Las Vegas.

programme.title: UFC - The Walk
programme.desc: An in-depth look at Valentina Shevchenko and Jessica Eye and their journeys to the Octagon ahead of UFC 238.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: The players of the 2000 Baltimore Ravens come together to reflect on their legendary year of winning the Super Bowl.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: Cincinnati hosts Pittsburgh. The Bearcats have won the past three meetings in a series first contested in 1921, including 27-21 in 2023. In Week 1, Eli Holstein's three TDs helped Pittsburgh pump Kent State 55-24, while Cincy took down Towson 38-20.

programme.title: College Football Scoreboard
programme.desc: Presenting up-to-the-minute scores and highlights during the college football season.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The Tigers host the Golden Bears. Auburn won the first meeting, 14-10 last season on Payton Thorne's five-yard touchdown pass to Rivaldo Fairweather with 6:31 remaining. Thorne accounted for five TDs in a 73-3 rout of Alabama A&M in Week 1.

programme.title: College Football Scoreboard
programme.desc: Presenting up-to-the-minute scores and highlights during the college football season.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The Demon Deacons host the Cavaliers. Hank Bachmeier, a sixth-year transfer via Louisiana Tech and Boise State, tossed three TDs in his Wake Forest debut Aug. 29, a 45-13 rout of North Carolina A&T. Wake Forest has won five consecutive meetings.

programme.title: College Football Scoreboard
programme.desc: Presenting up-to-the-minute scores and highlights during the college football season.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The Aggies (1-0) seek revenge on the Flames (1-0) in a Conference USA contest in Week 2. Liberty topped New Mexico State in the second week of action last year, and again in the C-USA championship game to cap off an unbeaten season in-conference.

programme.title: College Football Final
programme.desc: Once the day's slate of college football games is complete, ESPN recaps the action and discusses its implications on the top 25. Matt Barrie hosts with analysts Joey Galloway and Dan Mullen.

programme.title: TrueSouth
programme.desc: John T. Edge travels around the region, introducing viewers to Southern tastemakers, food, culture and history as they intertwine in the beautiful yet complex South.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: College Football Final
programme.desc: Once the day's slate of college football games is complete, ESPN recaps the action and discusses its implications on the top 25. Matt Barrie hosts with analysts Joey Galloway and Dan Mullen.

programme.title: ESPN Films
programme.desc: Series of documentaries looking back through the history of sports.

programme.title: The Breakdown with Peyton and Belichick
ESPN BET Live
programme.desc: ESPN Sports Betting Analysts Erin Dolan and Joe Fortenbaugh, along with host Tyler Fulghum, break down the biggest storylines through the lens of sports betting, with breakdowns, discussions and picks.

programme.title: Fantasy Football Now
programme.desc: "Fantasy Football Now" airs live on Sunday mornings during the NFL season, a time when fans are making last-minute roster moves and need the latest news from around the league. Providing the latest info are host Field Yates, analysts Mike Clay and Damien Woody, and senior writer and injury analyst Stephania Bell. Also contributing to the show are ESPN's NFL reporters, who bring fantasy players the latest intel from game sites and, in many cases, straight from the coach's mouth to give fantasy owners everything they need to know to set their lineups.

programme.title: College Football Final
programme.desc: Once the day's slate of college football games is complete, ESPN recaps the action and discusses its implications on the top 25. Matt Barrie hosts with analysts Joey Galloway and Dan Mullen.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The Badgers and the Coyotes match up in Week 2. Tyler Van Dyke threw for 192 yards and scored on the ground in his Wisconsin debut, a 28-14 triumph over Western Michigan. South Dakota rolled over Division II program Northern State 45-3 in its opener.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The Fighting Illini come together with the No. 19 Jayhawks in a Week 2 clash at Memorial Stadium. Illinois quarterback Luke Altmyer tossed four TD passes in a 45-0 triumph over Eastern Illinois in Week 1. Kansas bullied Lindenwood 48-3 in its opener.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: Quinn Ewers and the No. 3 Longhorns visit the Big House for a tilt with the No. 10 Wolverines. Texas won the only previous meeting, 38-37 in the 2005 Rose Bowl. Ewers threw three touchdown passes in Texas' 52-0 triumph over Colorado State in Week 1.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The Cougars host the Red Raiders in a clash of teams who combined to score 122 points in Week 1. Washington State defeated Portland State 70-30. Texas Tech's Behren Morton tossed five TD passes in a 52-51 overtime triumph over Abilene Christian.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The Bears play a new Big 12 counterpart in the No. 11 Utes. Utah made the jump from the Pac-12 for 2024-25. Cameron Rising's five TD passes helped Utah blank Southern Utah 49-0 on Aug. 29. Baylor thrashed Tarleton State 45-3 in its opener.

programme.title: NBA TV Marquee Matchup
programme.desc: Anthony Edwards scored 26 of his 28 points in the second half and the West-leading Minnesota Timberwolves beat the injury-ravaged Memphis Grizzlies, 118-103. From Jan. 18, 2024.

programme.title: NBA TV Marquee Matchup
programme.desc: Anthony Edwards scored 37 points, Nickeil Alexander-Walker added a season-high 28 and the Minnesota Timberwolves roared back from an early 22-point deficit for a 118-100 victory over the Los Angeles Clippers. From March 12, 2024.

programme.title: NBA TV Marquee Matchup
programme.desc: Jalen Brunson scored 24 points and Immanuel Quickley came off the bench to spark a huge turnaround as the Knicks rallied from a 21-point deficit to beat the Heat 100-98 and stay alive in the NBA's In-Season Tournament. From Nov. 24, 2023.

programme.title: NBA TV Marquee Matchup
programme.desc: From Dec. 15, 2023.

programme.title: NBA TV Marquee Matchup
programme.desc: Jalen Brunson scored 30 points, Julius Randle added 30 points, nine rebounds and seven assists and the New York Knicks extended their winning streak to four games with a 108-103 win over the Brooklyn Nets. From Jan. 23, 2024.

programme.title: NBA Playoff Playback
programme.desc: Watch the Knicks take on the Philadelphia 76ers in Game 1 of their first-round series, live from New York.

programme.title: NBA Playoff Playback
programme.desc: Donte DiVincenzo made a go-ahead 3-pointer with 13 seconds remaining after a desperate scramble, and New York beat the Philadelphia 76ers, 104-101, to take a 2-0 lead in their first-round playoff series.

programme.title: NBA Playoff Playback
programme.desc: Jalen Brunson scored a career playoff-high 47 points, added 10 assists and the Knicks beat the 76ers, 97-92, to take a 3-1 lead in their first-round playoff series.

programme.title: NBA Playoff Playback
programme.desc: Josh Hart raised his arms and extended three fingers on each hand on his go-ahead 3-pointer with 24.4 seconds left that was finally enough to help send the New York Knicks past the 76ers, 118-115, in Game 6 and into the second round of the playoffs.

programme.desc: The Mercury brace for the Storm. On June 16, Phoenix snapped a five-game slide versus Seattle and evened the season series with an 87-78 verdict. Olympic gold medalist Kahleah Copper (PHO) is averaging 24.5 points per game versus Seattle this year.

programme.title: NBA TV Marquee Matchup
programme.desc: Keldon Johnson stripped Kevin Durant and made a contested layup with 1.2 seconds left to give the San Antonio Spurs their only lead of the game and a 115-114 victory over the stunned Phoenix Suns. From Oct. 31, 2023.

programme.title: NBA TV Marquee Matchup
programme.desc: Rookie Victor Wembanyama scored a season-high 38 points, Zach Collins added 19 and the San Antonio Spurs held off Phoenix's late charge to beat the Suns 132-121. From Nov. 2, 2023.

programme.desc: Rookie Kobe Bryant wins his only slam dunk contest. Kobe Bryant, Chris Carr, Michael Finley, Darvin Ham, Ray Allen and Bob Sura compete in the 1997 contest. From Cleveland.

programme.title: Béisbol Esta Noche
programme.desc: Si usted es un fanático del béisbol, entonces no querrá perderse esta noche de recapitulación donde se muestran los momentos más destacados de todos los juegos y actualizaciones de los que siguen en curso. Regularmente presentado por Karl Ravech, quien está acompañado por una combinación de analistas, como los ex jugadores John Kruk y Dave Winfield, el ex manager Terry Francona, y los periodistas Tim Kurkjian y Buster Olney.
